Dialogue: I wanted to believe Tarr was lying.  All this time, thinking I'm fighting a war. It's a sham. Karla won years ago and we didn't even know it.

Speaker: peter guillam
Dialogue: What did he say?

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: Think of your wife. You have a wife, don't you? I brought you some cigarettes, by the way.

Speaker: peter guillam
Dialogue: That was Karla? And he flew back to die rather than give in?

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: Yes.  And that's how I know he can be beaten. Because he's a fanatic. And the fanatic is always concealing a secret doubt.

Speaker: peter guillam
Dialogue: What did he look like?

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: That's the thing.  I can't remember.

Speaker: richard
Dialogue: Nearly done.

Speaker: roach
Dialogue: Time sir?

Speaker: prideaux
Dialogue: Got your specs on Jumbo?

Speaker: roach
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Speaker: prideaux
Dialogue: Who's the fellow down there?

Speaker: roach
Dialogue: Don't know sir.

Speaker: prideaux
Dialogue: Who is he? Beggarman? Thief? Why doesn't he look this way?

Speaker: class
Dialogue: Best car in England!

Speaker: belinda
Dialogue: Stop it! Stop it!

Speaker: kaspar
Dialogue: Keep your bloody hands off her!

Speaker: scalphunter
Dialogue: Christ's sake, don't fight over a bit of skirt!

Speaker: jerry westerby
Dialogue: But that's the way it is, George, isn't it? When you're out, you're out. Too much of this stuff.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: I need to talk to you about the night Jim Prideaux was killed, Jerry. You were duty officer, weren't you?

Speaker: jerry westerby
Dialogue: Yes. Control asked me to man the phones that night. Said someone was doing a special job for the service. He wanted someone from outside he could trust. If anything came in, I was to tell him and only him.

Speaker: jerry westerby
Dialogue: Been a bit of a panic, sir.

Speaker: jerry westerby
Dialogue: Ann? I'm sorry to bother you. Is George back yet?

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: You rang my house?

Speaker: jerry westerby
Dialogue: Just on the off chance you were back from Berlin.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: What did you say?

Speaker: jerry westerby
Dialogue: Just that there'd been a bit of a crisis. She said you weren't back yet. That was it.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: Go on.

Speaker: jerry westerby
Dialogue: All hell broke loose - military yelling about Hungarian tank movements on the border, Lacon and the Minister baying at the door. Thank Christ Bill Haydon turned up when he did.

Speaker: bill haydon
Dialogue: Get out.

Speaker: jerry westerby
Dialogue: I tried to get hold of you...

Speaker: bill haydon
Dialogue: I just picked up half a story on the ticker-tape at my club... Tell me.

Speaker: jerry westerby
Dialogue: Jim Prideaux's been shot.

Speaker: haydon
Dialogue: Get me the Hungarian Embassy.

Speaker: jerry westerby
Dialogue: Yes sir...

Speaker: bill haydon
Dialogue: You go and tell your Masters what will happen if one hair on Jim Prideaux's head is damaged...

Speaker: jerry westerby
Dialogue: Any more news on him?

Speaker: bill haydon
Dialogue: We need to go to his flat. Clear out anything linked.

Speaker: peter guillam
Dialogue: Haydon heard the news at his club?

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: The Saville.

Speaker: peter guillam
Dialogue: At one-thirty? The ticker-tape wouldn't be running.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: Peter...

Speaker: peter guillam
Dialogue: Jesus Christ. Haydon? How could he have known?

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: It's not him, Peter.

Speaker: peter guillam
Dialogue: Then how did he know?

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: Because he was at my house that night. With Ann.

Speaker: old man
Dialogue: Just in case it's of interest, dear. We are observed. Old Filth in the bushes. Not very subtle but there you are...

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: Yes. Pleasant enough.

Speaker: bill haydon
Dialogue: I was just passing, thought I'd call in. Ann was in bed but she insisted on getting up. She said she'll be down in a minute.

Speaker: jim prideaux
Dialogue: Come in, Roach.

Speaker: roach
Dialogue: Sir there's a stranger parked down on the road. He's just sitting there.

Speaker: prideaux
Dialogue: It's alright, old fella. Don't cry. Nobody ever watched like you, did they? Off you go, now.

Speaker: roach
Dialogue: Are you going to have to leave?

Speaker: jim prideaux
Dialogue: I'll be fine. You get back to bed.

Speaker: control
Dialogue: You weren't followed?

Speaker: prideaux
Dialogue: Andras Benedek, Hungarian journalist based in Paris.

Speaker: control
Dialogue: If you're caught, you keep me out of it. You were acting alone, bit of Private Enterprise. Understood?

Speaker: prideaux
Dialogue: What information?

Speaker: control
Dialogue: Rocketry. Ballistics. Bit of politics.

Speaker: prideaux
Dialogue: What else?

Speaker: control
Dialogue: Treasure. He has treasure. The name of the Mole Moscow Centre has planted at the top of the Circus.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: Which means I was...?

Speaker: prideaux
Dialogue: You were Beggarman.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: What did you make of it, Jim? Control's theory?

Speaker: prideaux
Dialogue: I thought it was madness. To think any one of you could have been a traitor... madness.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: But still you went? Risking your life for a mission you thought was absurd? Why?

Speaker: prideaux
Dialogue: I went because Control asked me to go. It's called doing one's duty.

Speaker: prideaux
Dialogue: I held on as long as I could, to give everyone else time to get the hell out of there.  Did they?

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: No. They were blown. The story is you blew them to save your own skin.

Speaker: prideaux
Dialogue: The Mole. Control's crazy theory. I was going to bury that so deep, they'd never get it out of me. Which was a joke.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: prideaux
Dialogue: Because they already knew. They wanted to know how far Control had got in his investigation.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: What else?

Speaker: prideaux
Dialogue: Circus gossip. Was Percy's wife still drinking, who was Bland screwing in the office. That sort of thing.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: Did they ask about me at all?

Speaker: prideaux
Dialogue: One of them did.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: What did he say about me?

Speaker: prideaux
Dialogue: He had a cigarette lighter. Kept flashing it round for me to see. Showed me the inscription. "To George, from Ann. All my love." He reckoned after Bill's fling with her, she might want to change the inscription.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: That was well said.

Speaker: prideaux
Dialogue: He gave me a cigarette.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: Jim?

Speaker: prideaux
Dialogue: I thought it was my last one.

Speaker: man's voice
Dialogue: Do you know this woman?

Speaker: prideaux
Dialogue: I don't know her.

Speaker: peter guillam
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: Toby Esterhase.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: He gave him a thousand pounds. Told him he was dead now and couldn't come back. Had to become a Lotus Eater - forget everything that happened - Control's theory, Tinker, Tailor... all of it.

Speaker: peter guillam
Dialogue: You alright?

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: Will you watch my back, Peter? Look out for a solo. Just a feeling I've had.

Speaker: peter guillam
Dialogue: Yes, George. I'll watch.

Speaker: ricki tarr
Dialogue: She said there was a General, work-name Polyakov who was stationed in London. And that Polyakov's real job was to service the mole. He meets him regularly and takes back information the Mole gives him for Karla.  Smiley presses STOP. He presses RE-WIND, watches the tape spool BACKWARDS. He goes too far, presses FAST-FORWARD, watches the tape REVERSE DIRECTION. And, at this moment, we can tell from his expression, a piece of the jig-saw falls into place.

Speaker: minister
Dialogue: This meeting is not taking place. Is that clear?

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: Perfectly, Minister.  There is a house, somewhere in this city, where Alleline and the others meet Witchcraft's London representative. I need the address of that house.

Speaker: minister
Dialogue: I don't know what you're talking about.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: You told me to follow in Control's footsteps.

Speaker: minister
Dialogue: Well, I wouldn't consider that sound advice, after the bloody mess Control left us with. It's taken Alleline - and, if I may say so, myself - this long to get us back into the race.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: I'm glad you take some of the credit.

Speaker: minister
Dialogue: That's... that's not possible.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: Made possible. By you. When he steals our secrets he does it under the very nose of the Circus, in the house which you persuaded the treasury to pay for. I'm sure you'll be able to take full credit for that.

Speaker: minister
Dialogue: Witchcraft's intelligence is genuine! It's been gold!

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: Just enough glitter, amongst the chicken-feed. Control didn't believe in miracles and he didn't believe in Witchcraft. But you were lazy and you were greedy and so you hounded him out of the Circus and you let Karla in.

Speaker: minister
Dialogue: Oh God... We can't be made to look like fucking fools again! Forget Europe, if we have the black men getting to hear about this on Walla-Wallah News! What if we find the Mole and we move him sideways, some department where he can't do any harm? Is the Kremlin likely to boast about this?

Speaker: lacon
Dialogue: Not in their interests sir. They need the Enemy to look like a threat...

Speaker: minister
Dialogue: Well, tell them to play the game. We don't go crowing about their fuck-ups!

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: We are not the prize. We're the bait.

Speaker: minister
Dialogue: What can we do?

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: We have one thing the Mole wants.

Speaker: ricki tarr
Dialogue: If I go...

Speaker: peter guillam
Dialogue: You'll go...

Speaker: ricki tarr
Dialogue: ... I want your word you'll get Irina back. Don't care who you have to trade. I want a family. Don't wanna end up like you lot...

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: I'll do my utmost, Ricki.

Speaker: toby esterhase
Dialogue: What... what's this about George?

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: It's about which Master you've been serving, Toby.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: Intelligence has been leaked, Toby. Someone's been taking files from the Circus...

Speaker: toby esterhase
Dialogue: This is a mistake George, this is all...

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: The files were delivered to a Russian attache, weren't they?

Speaker: toby esterhase
Dialogue: Yes. And yes, I delivered them.

Speaker: toby esterhase
Dialogue: ... and Bill...

Speaker: toby esterhase
Dialogue: And Roy...

Speaker: toby esterhase
Dialogue: Things aren't always what they seem. You know that George. Moscow thinks Polyakov's working for them, so, every now and then we give him the odd file to take back to them, just chicken-feed, keep his bosses happy. But Polyakov's our Joe, part of a big operation...

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: Operation Witchcraft? Yes, I know.

Speaker: toby esterhase
Dialogue: Why are we here? Why are we...?

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: Who gave you the message for Jim to forget about Tinker Tailor?

Speaker: toby esterhase
Dialogue: Bland!

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: To get rid of Connie Sachs? Westerby?

Speaker: toby esterhase
Dialogue: Bland or Haydon. I don't remember. One of them. Maybe Percy. I don't know who.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: You're just the messenger? Running between them all. Anything to serve Witchcraft?

Speaker: toby esterhase
Dialogue: I didn't know. I swear I...

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: Are you still a wanted man, Toby?

Speaker: toby esterhase
Dialogue: George...!

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: You picked the wrong side, Toby.

Speaker: toby esterhase
Dialogue: George, you've got to believe me. I would never... I'm loyal, George. I'm loyal!

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: Give me the address. Where do you meet Polyakov?

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: What are the safety signals?

Speaker: mrs mccraig
Dialogue: There's an air duct. Open and all's well. Closed and you're not to enter.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: Where is the mike, Mrs McCraig?

Speaker: mrs mccraig
Dialogue: Whenever the gentlemen are meeting I record the session. The tapes are sent back to the Circus.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: If you're at all worried you can call Lacon from the basement phone. Let's try the tape recorder shall we?

Speaker: macklevore
Dialogue: Guest from London Station, Monsieur Fourcade.

Speaker: mackelvore
Dialogue: The whole service is looking for you, Ricki. They'll skin you alive if they find you.

Speaker: ricki tarr
Dialogue: Maybe I want them to find me.  Mackelvore frowns. They reach a door which he opens to reveal a STEEL DOOR beyond. He presses a bell and a hatch in the door slides open and a young man's face appears. This is BEN. He slides open a bolt, a double lock, and lets them into a ...

Speaker: mackelvore
Dialogue: You can go home now, Ben. Leave the books where they are and put the keys into the machines. I'll be talking to London presently under my own steam.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Okay boss.

Speaker: ricki tarr
Dialogue: Ben stays here.

Speaker: ricki tarr
Dialogue: Ricki Tarr claims to have further information vital to the safeguarding of the Circus.

Speaker: mendel
Dialogue: Tinker...

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: How's he look?

Speaker: ricki tarr
Dialogue: Read it aloud.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Personal for Tarr from Alleline...

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: ... send further information.

Speaker: ricki tarr
Dialogue: That's the way Percy boy! You keep stalling. I better warn you Ben, there's some lousy people in this outfit. Don't trust a fucking one of them.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: I'm here, Mendel.

Speaker: peter guillam
Dialogue: He's here.

Speaker: oliver lacon
Dialogue: I won't have bloodshed. I want absolute calm!

Speaker: on guillam
Dialogue: ... as his nerves and excitement and any hope he might have had of a sense of victory DRAINS AWAY, leaving him with just an odd sense of embarrassment and shame.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: I was assured there would be no coercion.

Speaker: bill haydon
Dialogue: It's almost funny George. I know the Inquisitors little bag of tricks. I taught most of them. Don't mind the tears. Just a reaction. An over-reaction, if you like. Craddox says I'll be off in a few days. I keep thinking how I'm going to miss the cricket in Moscow.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: If I can.

Speaker: bill haydon
Dialogue: There's a girl...Would you give her some money for me? Give her a good cover story. If it helps tell her I love her. It's all here.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: Of course.

Speaker: bill haydon
Dialogue: There's a boy too. Bung him a few quid to shut him up. Take it out of the reptile fund.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: I did have one or two questions. About Prideaux.

Speaker: bill haydon
Dialogue: Damn it! I got him back, didn't I?

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: Yes, yes you did. That was good of you.  I'm surprised Karla didn't shoot him. Or do you think he held back out of delicacy towards you?

Speaker: bill haydon
Dialogue: Yes, as a matter of fact he did.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: To say what?

Speaker: bill haydon
Dialogue: So did you.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: Did Karla ever consider having you take over the Circus?

Speaker: bill haydon
Dialogue: I'm not his bloody office boy.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: What are you then?

Speaker: bill haydon
Dialogue: I'm someone who made his mark.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: Is there anything you want me to pass on to Ann?

Speaker: bill haydon
Dialogue: Oh, that was nothing personal, George, I hope you understand that? Karla said you were good, the one we had to worry about. But you do have a blind spot.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: Up to a point.

Speaker: smiley
Dialogue: "Tailor."

Speaker: bill haydon
Dialogue: Best days.

Speaker: roach
Dialogue: I made you something.

Speaker: prideaux
Dialogue: I don't want you hanging around here. Keep away from me from now on. Go and join the others.

Dialogue: Shall we begin?
